title: OPT: status - analyze and optimize

labels.name: performance
labels.description: Improve performance of an existing feature

body:
I am not sure #5022 (as is) would not really provide remedy here since I do see `datalad` being busy already with 40% CPU while running status'ing, although py-spy does suggest that it is related to subprocesses:

```
 %Own   %Total  OwnTime  TotalTime  Function (filename:line)                                                                                                                                                                      
 30.00%  30.00%    3.62s     3.62s   _execute_child (subprocess.py:1637)
  5.00%   6.00%   0.420s    0.560s   _close_pipe_fds (subprocess.py:1104)
  4.00%   4.00%   0.390s    0.390s   _execute_child (subprocess.py:1648)
  6.00%  18.00%   0.360s     1.93s   _execute_child (subprocess.py:1650)
  2.00%   2.00%   0.250s    0.250s   _execute_child (subprocess.py:1658)
```
but I do not see them really appearing while looking at that process with `pstree` (there is some python process appearing, but no other children somehow :-/) .  So it might be worth looking in greater detail on what time is spent on and either python side of things could be optimized a bit beyond "do-in-parallel"
